p: With regard to coping styles, we found that a positive attitude was the strongest protective factors against distress. In fact, the higher the positive attitude, the lower distress levels. This finding was consistent with previous studies that found positive attitude in the workplace as the strategy with the biggest impact in reducing stress ( Khalid et al., 2016; Cai et al., 2020). This factor refers to a functional coping strategy that allows individuals to positively reinterpret negative situations, as it is related with self-efficacy, greater psychological wellbeing and better quality of life ( Flesia et al., 2020).
